title: MicroStrategy Launches $4.2B Preferred Stock Sale for Bitcoin Acquisition
summary: MicroStrategy announced a $4.2B sale of 10% Series A Perpetual Preferred Stock (STRD) through an ATM program, part of its '42/42' plan to raise $84B by 2027. The company holds 597,325 BTC with $14.05B unrealized gains and briefly paused purchases for the first time in three months.

title: SharpLink Gaming Builds Second-Largest ETH Treasury Worth $527M
summary: SharpLink disclosed holdings of 205,634 ETH (~$527.4M), making it the second-largest ether treasury after the Ethereum Foundation. The company bought 7,689 ETH between June 28-July 4 and raised $64M via share sales, with Consensys CEO Joseph Lubin serving as chairman.

title: PumpFun's $600M Token Sale Cancelled After Community Backlash
summary: PumpFun planned to sell 150B PUMP tokens for $600M on Gate at a $4B valuation, but pulled the listing after criticism over 'bad optics'. Users expected an airdrop given the project's $700M revenue, while competitor LetsBonk has overtaken PumpFun in tokens created and revenue.

title: Phantom Wallet Integrates Perpetual Trading via Hyperliquid API
summary: Phantom is launching perp contract trading directly in its wallet for EU users, offering up to 40x leverage through Hyperliquid's API. Hyperliquid has processed over $1.57T in perp volume and recently raised $150M at a $3B valuation, positioning wallets as primary hubs for onchain activity.

title: New Zealand to Ban Crypto ATMs in Regulatory Crackdown
summary: New Zealand announced plans to ban cryptocurrency ATMs as part of broader regulatory measures. This follows similar moves by other jurisdictions concerned about money laundering and consumer protection risks associated with crypto ATM operations.

title: BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF IBIT Surpasses 700,000 BTC in Assets
summary: BlackRock's spot Bitcoin ETF (IBIT) has exceeded 700,000 BTC in assets under management, demonstrating strong institutional demand. This milestone reinforces BlackRock's position as a dominant player in the crypto ETF market.

title: Two Men Charged in $650M Crypto and Forex Fraud Scheme
summary: Authorities charged two individuals in a massive $650M global fraud scheme involving foreign exchange trading and cryptocurrency. The case highlights ongoing regulatory efforts to combat large-scale financial crimes in the crypto space.
